title: "Excited Delirium" or "Agitated Delirium” Police Department Training, Whittier, CA

communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-All current or past training materials for the Whittier Police Department which mention or describe how to handle "excited delirium" or "agitated delirium”.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.

Greg Buhl

title: Whittier Police Department Pursuit, Crash, Injury, and Fatality Statistics (CHP)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting copies of the following records:

-All pursuit, crash, injury, and fatality statistics the CHP maintains on the Whittier Police Department. If these are available online somewhere, pointing that url out to me would be sufficient. All I can find online is references to CHP maintaining such statistic, but not the the actual data. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA. This request is being made in the public interest. The information is not being requested for any commercial purpose and will be made freely available to journalists.

Greg Buhl

Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any invoices, purchase orders, or contracts related to the purchase of automated license plate readers (ALPRs) or subscriptions of ALPR related services.  

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

*The requested documents will be made available to the general public via Muckrock, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a published citizen-journalist with articles in the Long Beach Beachcomber and on FORTHE.org. My research has been featured by the Los Angeles Times, Long Beach Post, Knock-LA, and other local publications.

Sincerely,

Gregory Buhl
lead researcher at CheckLBPD.org

title: Vendor Invoice/Purchase Order Spreadsheet - Whittier CA Police

communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any spreadsheet or list maintained by the WPD showing all invoices and purchase orders submitted by or paid to vendors.  If such a spreadsheet can be produced from the Department’s accounting software showing amount of payment, date of payment, payee, and description of reason for payment, then I am requesting that spreadsheet.   Please cover a period going back to 2012.  

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

*The requested documents will be made available to the general public via Muckrock, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a published citizen-journalist with articles in the Long Beach Beachcomber and on FORTHE.org. My research has been featured by the Los Angeles Times, Long Beach Post, Knock-LA, and other local publications.

Gregory Buhl

title: Use of Force with GBI reports - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, interviews, or similar investigative material in the department’s possession related to investigated Use of Force incidents involving WPD officers that caused Great Bodily Injury as defined by the state legislature (Injuries requiring 10 or more sutures and/or staples, Broken bones, All head injuries, Any injury deemed as serious. “Serious bodily injury” means injuries that involve a substantial risk of death, unconsciousness, protracted and obvious disfigurement, or protracted loss or impairment of the function of a bodily member or organ.)  Apologies if you already have this information posted to your website to comply with SB 1421 but I do not seem to be able to find it posted. 


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

*The requested documents will be made available to the general public via Muckrock, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a published citizen-journalist with articles in the Long Beach Beachcomber and on FORTHE.org. My research has been featured by the Los Angeles Times, Long Beach Post, Knock-LA, and other local publications.

Sincerely,

Gregory Buhl
lead researcher at CheckLBPD.org

title: Civil Asset Forfeitture - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.communication:
Hello,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act I am requesting the following records:

-Any accounting records or statistics on seized real estate, vehicles, firearms, funds in bank accounts and seizures made by the WPD, as well as seizures made by federal authorities where the WPD receives a share under the MOUs the department have in place with numerous agencies describing how assets are to be divided.

-Any annual reports produced on the WPD civil asset forfeiture program.

-Documents showing the balance of any funds currently in the WPD Civil Asset Forfeiture fund.

-A list of all items seized through civil asset forfeiture and retained for use by the WPD.

-Please also include any information relating to contested seizures. This request does not include court documents for individual forfeiture cases.

The time period for this request is for the last 10 years.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter in the time frame set out in the CPRA.

Greg Buhl
Lead Researcher at CheckLBPD.org

title: Use of Force and Police Shooting Videos

communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All video and audio recordings in the Department’s possession involving a discharge of a firearm and any use of force by an officer or custodial officer against a person resulting in death or great bodily injury.  Apologies if you already have this information posted to your website to comply with AB 748, but I do not seem to be able to find it posted.  


Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

title: LACRIS Facial Recognition Use - Whittier CA Police Dept

communications.communication:
Hello:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents sufficient to show the number of times the Whittier Police Department has used the Los Angeles County Regional Identification System (LACRIS) to run facial recognition searches. I would settle for raw figures of the number of searches per month rather than have you produce voluminous documents to fulfill this request.  

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

*The requested documents will be made available to the general public via Muckrock, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am a published citizen-journalist with articles in the Long Beach Beachcomber and on FORTHE.org. My research has been featured by the Los Angeles Times, Long Beach Post, Knock-LA, and other local publications.

Sincerely,

Gregory Buhl
lead researcher at CheckLBPD.org
